featured.text: But nowadays, autographs (signatures) are big business.
What is the real reason many collectors want autographs?
Some of the police officers asked him for his autograph.
Autograph dealers can be found in almost any sizable city, and collectors may get hundreds, even thousands, of dollars for things signed by anyone from Mozart to Madonna, Thomas Jefferson to JFK.
I mistook the man for a well-known actor and asked for his autograph; it was really _____.

definition.zh_def: 親筆簽名，通常是名人或著名人物的簽名。
definition.en_def: A person's signature, especially that of a celebrity or famous individual.
definition.example: I got the actor's autograph after the movie premiere.
